message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a unique opportunity to purchase a high-value product. I believe it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to start the conversation with a price of $1200000. What do you think?
I appreciate your offer, but I think the product is worth less than that. I'm willing to pay $800000 for it.

I understand you think the product is worth less, but I'm confident it's a game-changer. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, but I need to make a profit. I'm counteroffering at $1000000. What do you think?
I understand your concerns, but I'm still not willing to pay that much. I'm willing to pay $900000 for the product.

I understand you're trying to get a good deal, but I'm not willing to go that low. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make a decent profit. I'm counteroffering at $950000. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.
I understand your final offer, but I'm still not willing to pay that much. I'm willing to pay $920000 for the product.

I'm starting to think we're not on the same page, Bob. I'm willing to make one more attempt to find common ground. I'm counteroffering at $980000. This is my last serious offer, and I expect it to be taken seriously.
I understand your persistence, but I'm still not willing to pay that much. I'm willing to pay $930000 for the product.

I'm not willing to give up yet, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to see a serious commitment from you. I'm counteroffering at $960000. If this isn't acceptable, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand your last offer, but I'm still not willing to pay that much. I'm willing to pay $940000 for the product.
